intro: Populus simonii var. tsinlingensis, commonly known as the Tsingling poplar, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its slender, fast-growing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in catkins, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
